title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Kazipet Railway Manufacturing Unit to Begin by 2026
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- The *Kazipet Railway Manufacturing Unit* in Telangana will start operations by **2026**.  
- The facility, with a **₹500 crore** investment, aims to manufacture railway coaches and engines, enhancing local *employment* opportunities.  
- Union Minister *Ashwini Vaishnaw* stated that this modern factory will utilize the latest technology, including **robotic painting**, to boost efficiency.

items.title: The Future of Indian Exports via Indigenous Manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Indigenous manufacturing* at port cities can enhance the speed and efficiency of exports in India.
- This strategy aims to reduce logistics costs by co-locating production with ports, potentially increasing India's export performance significantly.
- To maximize benefits, India needs to focus on *policy integration*, *infrastructure development*, and *export-linked incentives* to support coastal manufacturing initiatives.

items.title: RRP Defence Partners with CYGR for Drone Plant
items.summary:
- RRP Defence has partnered with French firm *CYGR* to establish a *drone manufacturing facility* in *Navi Mumbai*.
- The initial investment of around **USD 50 million** aims to produce advanced drone systems for *defense* and *industrial use*.
- This collaboration will enhance India's *high-skill employment* and boost *aerospace exports*.

items.title: India aims to be among top 5 chipmaking nations: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- Union Minister **Ashwini Vaishnaw** announced India's ambition to become a top-5 semiconductor nation.
- India is developing a *full ecosystem* for semiconductor production, with students designing chipsets now in *fabrication*.
- The country’s **electronics exports** have surged significantly, supporting major advancements in the semiconductor industry.

items.title: Shortsighted rules, shrinking growth: How legal metrology thwarts India’s manufacturing dream
items.author: Lakshita Mehrotra, Sudhanshu Neema
items.summary:
* India's legal metrology regulations cause unnecessary burdens for manufacturers with overly complex labeling and measurement requirements. 
* These regulations lead to confusion and legal battles, stifling growth, particularly for MSMEs. 
* Simplifying these laws could foster a more robust manufacturing sector and enhance consumer protection through risk-based, digital-first approaches.

items.title: Nvidia's China Restart Faces Production Obstacles
items.summary:
- *Nvidia* has limited supplies of its most powerful **AI chip**, the H20, due to U.S. export restrictions, although it plans to resume sales to China. 
- The U.S. government's April ban affected production, causing *Nvidia* to void customer orders and manufacturing capacity with **TSMC**. 
- CEO **Jensen Huang** stated new chip production may take nine months, while *Nvidia* develops a compliant chip, the **RTX Pro GPU**.

items.title: Indian electronics exports hit $40 bn
items.summary:
- India's electronics exports surpassed *$40 billion*, marking an **eight-fold** growth over 11 years.
- Domestic production of electronics has increased by *six times*, highlighting rapid sector development.
- Minister *Ashwini Vaishnaw* emphasized India's ambition to be among the top five semiconductor nations soon, with upcoming projects like the *Made in India* semiconductor chip.

items.title: Torrent Pharma Seeks CCI Nod for Major JB Chemicals Acquisition
items.summary:
- Torrent Pharmaceuticals is seeking *CCI clearance* to acquire a majority stake in *JB Chemicals* for ₹19,500 crore.
- This acquisition will catapult Torrent to become India's second-largest *pharmaceutical company*.
- The deal involves acquiring 46.39% from promoters and making an open offer for an additional 26% stake.

items.title: US proposes steep tariffs on critical EV battery material
items.summary:
* The US Commerce Department has imposed **93.5% tariffs** on imported graphite essential for EV batteries, citing 'dumping' practices by Chinese suppliers. 
* This decision adds pressure on automakers like **Tesla** and **Ford**, escalating production costs for electric vehicles as tax credits are set to expire. 
* The ruling affects US manufacturers investing in battery production, with potential price increases of **$1,000 or more** for consumers due to rising raw material costs.

items.title: MP First Choice of Investors: CM Mohan Yadav at Diaspora Address
items.summary:
- *Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav* emphasized the state's position as the *first choice for investors*, fostering national progress.
- During the *Madhya Pradesh Global Dialogue 2025*, Yadav conducted discussions with European textile machinery leaders on establishing production hubs in Madhya Pradesh.
- He highlighted *investor-friendly policies* and the commitment to *sustainable production*, inviting European companies to invest in the region.

items.title: Amidst complaints, Dukes ball used in England-India Tests to be examined by manufacturers
Madhya Pradesh CM Meets Textile Manufacturers in Barcelona
items.summary:
- *Chief Minister Mohan Yadav* held a round-table in Barcelona with global textile machinery firms to promote Madhya Pradesh as a **manufacturing hub**.
- The meeting emphasized *technology transfer*, partnerships with European companies, and establishing dedicated textile parks in the state.
- Yadav highlighted Madhya Pradesh's favorable investment climate, supporting *sustainable production* initiatives under the *Make in India* campaign.

items.title: World’s first ethanol-to-jet fuel plant set to launch by September
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *LanzaJet Inc* is launching the world’s first ethanol-to-jet fuel plant in Georgia by the end of September 2025, after delays due to equipment issues.
- The plant, costing $200 million, aims to produce 10 million gallons of **sustainable aviation fuel (SAF)** and renewable diesel annually.
- Initial production will rely on *Brazilian sugar-cane ethanol*, as domestic *corn-based ethanol* typically does not meet the emissions reduction standards required for certain tax credits.

items.title: India commissions indigenously built diving support vessel
items.summary:
*India has commissioned INS Nistar,* its first indigenously designed diving support vessel, capable of **deep-sea saturation diving** and **submarine rescue operations**. 
 *The vessel, built by Hindustan Shipyard Ltd, features over 80% indigenous content* and serves as a critical operational asset for both the Indian Navy and regional partners. 
 *INS Nistar's advanced technology enables it to conduct operations up to 1,000 metres deep,* enhancing India's capabilities in submarine rescue missions.

items.title: Wheels India Expands Exports and Segments
items.summary:
- *Wheels India Ltd* is expanding its export business, with notable progress in the **construction** and **tractor** segments.
- The company reported a *56% rise* in net profit for FY2025, reflecting robust growth despite tariff uncertainties.
- It is now a significant supplier to **electric vehicle** manufacturers, enhancing its market presence in various sectors.

items.title: PepsiCo Reports Growth in Snacks Business in India
items.summary:
- PepsiCo achieved *4% organic revenue growth* in its snacks sector during Q2 2025, prominently aided by markets like India.
- The company faced *declines in its beverages segment*, particularly in India, due to unseasonal weather affecting sales.
- Overall, PepsiCo's *net revenue rose by 1%* to USD 22.72 billion, with positive forecasts for ongoing resilience in its international business.

items.title: Everta aims to locally produce 3k DC chargers annually by 2027
items.summary:
- *Everta* plans to manufacture 3,000 DC chargers each year by 2027, investing ₹150 crore in its *Karnataka* facility.
- The company aims for a 15% market share in the DC charger segment by 2030, responding to a projected demand for 4 million public chargers.
- Through its partnership with *StarCharge*, Everta targets over 50% domestic value addition, promoting *local production* and reducing import reliance.

items.title: First made in India semiconductor chip to be rolled out this year
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- India’s first *indigenous semiconductor chip* will be launched in 2025, according to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.
- The country aims to become a leading player in the *semiconductor manufacturing* sector, with six plants already approved.
- As part of the *India AI Mission*, training programs for AI usage are underway, with a goal of preparing one million individuals.

items.title: Perplexity's Talks to Pre-install Comet AI Browser
items.summary:
- *Perplexity AI*, supported by **Nvidia**, is in discussions with smartphone manufacturers to pre-install its new **Comet AI browser**.
- This strategy aims to capitalize on browser *stickiness*, enhancing user engagement with Perplexity’s tools by setting Comet as the **default** browser.
- The initiative could expand Perplexity's reach notably, targeting *hundreds of millions* of users in the forthcoming year after refining the desktop version.

items.title: BatX Energies and Rocklink's Rare Earth Magnet Recycling MoU
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- BatX Energies has partnered with Rocklink GmbH to create India's first integrated ecosystem for *rare earth magnet recycling*.
- The initiative combines BatX’s operational presence with Rocklink’s technical expertise and aligns with the *EU–India Trade and Technology Council*.
- The project will launch *India's first rare earth magnet refining facility* and aims to enhance the country's self-reliance in rare earth materials.

items.title: India, UK Likely to Unveil Free Trade Agreement Next Week
items.summary:
- India and the UK plan to finalize a *free trade agreement* next week, enhancing *duty-free access* for Indian textiles and electric vehicles.
- The deal will significantly reduce tariffs on British exports such as *whisky* and *cars*, fostering *bilateral trade*.
- Expected to be signed during Indian PM Modi's visit to London, the pact could benefit 99% of Indian exports to the UK.

items.title: Manali Petrochemicals expands Propylene Glycol capacity
items.summary:
- **Manali Petrochemicals Ltd** has enhanced its *Propylene Glycol* production capacity by 50,000 KTPA, aiming to reduce reliance on imports.
- This expansion supports the *'Make in India'* initiative and is expected to foster India’s global manufacturing competitiveness.
- Chairman Ashwin Muthiah emphasized the company's commitment to *sustainable growth* and market leadership in the domestic sector.

items.title: Reliance acquires Kelvinator from Electrolux
items.summary:
- *Reliance Industries* has purchased the *Kelvinator* brand from Sweden's *Electrolux*, indicating a strategic growth in the *consumer durables market*.
- The acquisition follows a licensing agreement that had been in place since 2019, during which Reliance has promoted Kelvinator appliances.
- India's consumer goods market is rapidly expanding, projected to nearly double by 2029, as noted in an EY report.

items.title: Udaan Acquires ShopKirana to Enhance FMCG Sector
items.summary:
- Udaan has acquired ShopKirana in an all-stock deal, enhancing its FMCG capabilities.
- The acquisition allows Udaan to leverage ShopKirana's extensive kirana network and expertise, improving operational efficiency.
- Udaan aims to use recent funding to expand its FMCG presence and profitability, having reduced costs significantly.

items.title: Anand Shah on Optimism in Metal Manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Anand Shah*, CIO at ICICI Prudential AMC, notes that while *ferrous metal profitability* is under pressure due to strong Chinese exports, there is optimism for margin recovery in select sectors. 
- He remains positive about *manufacturing*, particularly in *defense* and *railways*, but acknowledges that current valuations are becoming less attractive. 
- Shah emphasizes a *bottom-up approach* to investing, focusing on sectors with promising earnings growth relative to *valuations*.

items.title: India to Collaborate with France on Fighter Jet Engine
items.summary:
- The *Defence Ministry* of India proposes a ₹61,000 crore project for next-generation fighter jet engines in collaboration with *France*.
- This initiative aims to achieve *self-reliance* by developing indigenous manufacturing capabilities for vital defense technologies.
- India assesses technical bids from *Safran* and *Rolls Royce*, with a focus on comprehensive technology transfer and cost implications.

items.title: Chinese Sanctions Impact India's Electronics Sector
items.summary:
- *Informal restrictions* by China on *capital equipment* and *critical minerals* threaten India's electronics manufacturing. 
- The **India Cellular and Electronics Association** (ICEA) highlights that these sanctions raise production costs and disrupt supply chains. 
- Urgent measures are needed to mitigate the *adverse effects* of these informal Chinese sanctions on India's manufacturing ecosystem.

items.title: Texmaco Rail commissions 10-MW solar plant in Raipur
items.summary:
- Texmaco Rail has launched a **10-MW captive solar power plant** in Raipur, enhancing its **green energy transition** efforts.
- Developed with **AMP Energy India**, the plant is expected to generate **15 million units of clean energy** annually, offsetting over **12,000 tonnes** of CO2 emissions.
- This initiative aligns with Texmaco's **sustainability roadmap**, promising cost savings and a reduction in grid dependency.

items.title: Dodla Dairy acquires Osam Dairy for ₹271 cr
items.summary:
- *Dodla Dairy* has acquired *Osam Dairy* for ₹271 crores, enhancing its presence in eastern India's dairy market.
- This transaction is one of the first major deals in the region's dairy sector, attracting significant institutional investment.
- Outgoing CEO Abhinav Shah highlighted that this acquisition will propel Osam’s growth after a decade of building its brand.

items.title: Arunachal's Hydro Power Corp Earns Carbon Credit Nod
items.summary:
- The *Hydro Power Development Corporation of Arunachal Pradesh Limited* has received carbon credit validation for its *Zemithang* hydro project.  
- This achievement highlights HPDCAPL's role in India’s *green energy* initiatives and its commitment to achieving *net zero emissions* by 2070.  
- The project has already earned 16,326 tonnes of carbon credits with a goal of 97,783 tonnes by 2028.

items.title: India's $1.5 Trillion Climate Investment by 2030
items.summary:
- India requires an investment of **$1.5 trillion** by 2030 to combat climate change and transition to renewable energy.
- Key sectors include **renewable energy**, **biofuels**, and **sustainable infrastructure**.
- Investments in digital technologies and enhanced energy storage are also crucial for achieving sustainability goals.

items.title: Tata Power Renewable bags 30 MW/120MWh battery project
items.summary:
- *Tata Power Renewable Energy Ltd* secured a 30 MW/120 MWh battery energy storage project from NHPC. 
- The project will enhance *grid resilience* and facilitate the integration of *renewable energy* in Kerala, addressing peak power demands. 
- It supports NHPC’s broader goal of establishing *125 MW / 500 MWh* standalone battery capacity under a competitive bidding framework.

items.title: Stellantis expands production capacity at Morocco plant
Telangana CM Revanth Reddy Seeks Faster Approvals for Semiconductor Projects
items.author: Sribala Vadlapatla, TNN
items.summary:
- Chief Minister *Revanth Reddy* urges faster *approvals* for semiconductor projects to bolster Telangana's economy.
- Focus on establishing infrastructure like the *Hi-Tech Electronics Park* and new electronic manufacturing parks around *Hyderabad*.
- Emphasis on enhancing *railway connectivity*, proposing projects to improve transportation and urban development in the region.

items.title: Maharashtra's First Green Hydrogen Plant by Sterlite Technologies
items.summary:
- *Sterlite Technologies Ltd.* collaborates with Hygenco for Maharashtra's first green hydrogen facility aimed at optical fibre production.
- The project aims to reduce carbon emissions by approximately *30% annually* and is a major step towards achieving *Net Zero by 2030*.
- This partnership allows STL to set a global benchmark in the optical fibre industry by utilizing *100% green hydrogen* in its manufacturing processes.

items.title: TSMC Accelerates US Expansion in Arizona
items.summary:
- TSMC is **fast-tracking** construction of new semiconductor fabs in Arizona to meet the rising demand for advanced chips.
- A planned **gigafab cluster** will enhance the state’s role in TSMC's global operations, eventually contributing to 30% of its advanced chip production.
- The total investment reaches **USD 65 billion**, with an additional **USD 100 billion** planned for future expansions in the US.

items.title: Challenges Faced by India's Small Fertiliser Manufacturers
items.summary:
- India’s small fertiliser manufacturers are struggling due to *high imports*, regulatory burdens, and *increased costs*.
- Moreover, the *outdated regulatory framework* and preference for imports are stifling the growth of domestic specialty fertiliser producers.
- Despite rising demand for specialty fertilisers, compliance costs and an **uneven subsidy structure** favor larger companies, further disadvantaging MSMEs.

items.title: Ample Targets 35% Revenue Growth Amid Expansion Plans
items.summary:
- *Ample*, an Indian Apple reseller, aims for a **35% revenue increase** in fiscal 2026 through store and portfolio expansion.
- Currently, the company operates **120 stores**, with plans to grow to **175 stores** in three years while partnering with global capability centers.
- The firm also intends to **list on stock exchanges** within five years to support its ambitious growth strategy.

items.title: Microchip and Delta Electronics Partnership
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Microchip* and *Delta Electronics* have partnered to develop advanced **SiC power solutions** for electrification and energy efficiency.
- This collaboration aims to integrate Microchip’s mSiC products with Delta’s power management systems, focusing on high-voltage applications.
- The initiative supports fast-growing sectors like *artificial intelligence*, *electric mobility*, and *industrial automation*, emphasizing the importance of SiC technology in sustainable power solutions.

items.title: China's Trade Restrictions Threaten India's Smartphone Exports
items.summary:
- China’s *informal trade restrictions* may jeopardize India’s goal of $32 billion in smartphone exports during the current fiscal year.
- The *India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA)* warns that these actions are damaging supply chains and raising production costs.
- If unresolved, these disruptions could reverse India's progress and impact its integration into *global value chains*.

items.title: US Solar Panel Manufacturers Seek Tariffs on Indian Imports
items.summary:
- A coalition of *US solar panel manufacturers* is urging the *Commerce Department* to impose tariffs on imports from India, Indonesia, and Laos.
- This move aims to provide trade relief amidst heavy competition from *Chinese manufacturers* and protect significant investments in the sector.
- The *Alliance for American Solar Manufacturing and Trade*, including major companies like First Solar and Hanwha, filed the petition for these anti-dumping tariffs.

items.title: India mulls ‘green feeders’ to power hydrogen, data centres
items.author: Shilpa Samant, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India is exploring a *green energy feeder system* for *green hydrogen manufacturing* and data centres due to rising global demand.
- The project aims to identify transmission lines delivering over *90% green energy*, primarily in solar and wind-rich areas.
- This initiative will help differentiate *green energy* in the grid, allowing manufacturers to label products made from renewable sources.

items.title: ACME Solar signs BESS agreements with NHPC for Andhra Pradesh projects
Intel to Lay Off Over 5,500 Employees in US
items.summary:
- Intel plans to cut over **5,500 jobs** across the US, surpassing initial estimates of 4,000 layoffs.
- The largest impacts will be in **California** and **Oregon**, where thousands of positions are set to be eliminated due to restructuring efforts under new CEO Lip-Bu Tan.
- The layoffs are intended to help Intel become more **competitive** in the AI chip market, where it currently lags behind rivals like **Nvidia** and **AMD**.

items.title: Kinetic Green's Global Ambitions with Tonino Lamborghini
items.author: Kriti Saraiya
items.summary:
- Kinetic Green and Tonino Lamborghini have formed a joint venture to manufacture *electric golf carts*, focusing on both Indian and global markets.
- The joint venture aims to invest **$20 million**, with Kinetic Green holding a 70% stake, and plans to become a leader in the *$5 billion global golf cart market*.
- Initial distribution will target Asia (India, UAE) before expanding to Europe and the US, aiming for **$300 million** in annual revenue within five years.

items.title: HAL Receives Wing Assemblies for LCA Mk1A
items.summary:
- HAL has received the first set of **wing assemblies** for the **LCA Mk1A** from **Larsen & Toubro** in Tamil Nadu.
- The event highlighted the collaboration aimed at achieving *self-reliance* in the **aerospace** and **defence** sector.
- **HAL** plans to enhance production capabilities, aiming for increased manufacturing output of wing sets.

items.title: Smartphone Makers Buzz Red Alert over Chinese Restrictions
items.author: Kiran Rathee, ET Online
items.summary:
- **India's electronics industry** warns that *Chinese trade restrictions* threaten its $32 billion smartphone export target this fiscal year.
- *Delays and inflated costs* for manufacturers are arising from China's informal controls on capital equipment and skilled personnel.
- The **India Cellular and Electronics Association** emphasizes that these disruptions could reverse India’s recent gains in global *electronics manufacturing* integration.

items.title: Trump Offers Regulatory Relief for Key Industries
items.summary:
* President Trump is granting a two-year regulatory relief for **coal-fired power plants**, chemical manufacturers, and industries deemed vital for national security.  
* The exemptions overturn many **Biden-era regulations** aimed at pollution reduction, which Trump labeled as overly burdensome.  
* Environmental groups criticize these changes, claiming it leads to increased **toxic emissions** and undermines public health protections.

items.title: US solar panel manufacturers seek tariffs on Indian imports
Prostarm Info Systems to invest $2.9 mn in 1.2 GWh battery energy storage plant in Haryana by 2026
